metadata.inclusion: Turn the primary controller of Z-Wave network into inclusion mode, short press the product’s Z-Wave button that you can find in the back of the product
metadata.exclusion: Turn the primary controller of Z-Wave network into exclusion mode, short press the product’s Z-Wave button that you can find in back of the product
metadata.reset: Press and hold the Z-Wave button that you can find in back of the product for 20 seconds and then release. This procedure should only be used when the primary controller is inoperable

metadata.inclusion: Turn the primary controller of Z-Wave network into inclusion mode, quickly press key S1 or B-button on product's housing three times
metadata.exclusion: Turn the primary controller of Z-Wave network into exclusion mode, quickly press key S1 or B-button on product's housing three times
metadata.reset:
1. Power-cycle the device
2. Press and hold the B-button to enter the menu
3. Wait for the LED to turn yellow
4. Quickly release and click B-button again
5. Device will restart and LED will turn red

metadata.inclusion:
1. Press the sensor latch with a slotting screwdriver to remove the lid of the sensor.
2. Squeeze the sides of the sensor casing to alleviate pressure on the chipboard; slide the chipboard out.
3. Remove the Pull Tab to engage the pre-installed battery. The sensor’s LED will fade the color red in and out for a few seconds to indicate that it’s powered on.
4. Set your gateway into its 'add device' mode. Refer to its manual if you are unsure of how to perform this step. Then press Recessed Door Sensor 7's Action Button once; its LED will blink.
If your gateway supports S2 security, and you want your device to use this higher level of security, please enter the first 5 digits of the DSK into the gateway's interface when prompted. Refer to the gateway's manual if you are unsure how to perform this step. Do not lose the DSK or remove it from the product or package.
5. When Recessed Door Sensor 7 successfully joins your Z-Wave network its LED will turn solid red for 10 minutes and then off. If fails, its LED turns slow fade-in fade-out red color. Repeat the above steps and please contact us for further support if needed.
6. Squeeze the sides of the sensor casing lightly again and re-insert the chipboard as it was. Re-attach the lid
metadata.exclusion:
1. Set your Z-Wave Controller into its 'Remove Device' mode in order to remove the product from your Z-Wave system. Refer to the Controller's manual if you are unsure of how to perform this step.
2. Make sure the product is powered. 
3. Single-click Action Button; LED will become flash red color for 5 seconds, which indicates entering exclusion mode. 
4. If the exclusion is successful, LED will change to the default unpaired state which is slow fade-in fade-out red color. 
5. Should its LED extinguish without slow fade-in fade-out red color, it indicates the exclusion is unsuccessful. Contact us for further support if needed
metadata.reset:
If the primary controller is missing or inoperable, you may need to reset the device to factory settings.
Make sure the product is powered. To complete the reset process manually, press and hold the Action Button for at least 20s, and Factory Reset is performed when released. The LED will become slow fade-in fade-out red color, which indicates the reset operation is successful. Contact us for further support if needed. 
Note: 
1. This procedure should only be used when the primary controller is missing or inoperable.
2. Factory Reset will:
(a) Remove the product from Z-Wave network;
(b) Delete the Association setting;
(c) Restore the configuration settings to the default.

states.1: Send Basic Set 0xff when magnet is away; Basic Set 0x00 when near
states.2: Send Basic Set 0x00 when magnet is away; Basic Set 0xff when near
states.3: Only send Basic Set 0xff when magnet is away
states.4: Only send Basic Set 0x00 when magnet is near
states.5: Only send Basic Set 0x00 when magnet is away
states.6: Only send Basic Set 0xff when magnet is near

metadata.description: Configure whether the LED will flash or not when sending Basic Set, Binary Sensor Report, Notification Report (Access Control) or Wake Up Notification.

states.1: Flash when transmitting (Except wake up notifications)
states.2: On when sending wake up notification
states.3: Flash when transmitting (Including wake up notifications)

metadata.description: This property is used to set the length of the On time during an On/Off period. It allows asymmetric On/Off periods. The value 0x00 MUST represent symmetric On/Off period (On time equal to Off time)
metadata.label: Node Identify - On/Off Period: On time

metadata.inclusion:
Press configuration button 3 times. LED3 is ON.
Press and hold once more for 4 seconds
metadata.exclusion:
Press configuration button 3 times. LED3 is ON.
Press and hold once more for 4 seconds
metadata.reset:
Press configuration button 25x times. LED 1 is ON. Press and hold once more for 4 seconds to confirm.
Please use this procedure only when your network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable

metadata.description: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.
metadata.label: Motion Sensor Sensitivity

metadata.description: Period of time through which the PIR sensor won't detect motion after detecting motion.
metadata.label: After Motion Blind Time

metadata.description: Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The more the value is, the less sensitive it is.
metadata.label: Motion Pulses Required

metadata.description: The amount of time the movements specified in parameter #3 need to take place in. The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.
metadata.label: Motion Window Time

metadata.description: Amount of time the alarm will be canceled after.
metadata.label: Motion Alarm Cancellation Delay

metadata.description: The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active.
metadata.label: Motion Day/Night Mode

states.1: PIR sensor active during the day only
states.2: PIR sensor active during the night only

metadata.description: The difference between night and day, used in parameter #8.
metadata.label: Night/Day Threshold

metadata.description: The value of 0 allows to turn OFF a device.

metadata.description: This parameter allows to disable cancellation of the tamper alarm.
metadata.label: Tamper Alarm Cancellation

metadata.description: Determines whether the tamper alarm frame will be sent in broadcast mode
metadata.label: Tamper Alarm Broadcast Mode

states.1: Reported in broadcast mode to 3rd assoc grp

metadata.description: Determines whether the tamper alarm frame will be sent in broadcast mode
metadata.label: Tamper Backward Compatible Broadcast Mode

metadata.description: Minimum change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report.
metadata.label: Illuminance Report Threshold

metadata.description: Time interval between consecutive illumination reports (sent even when there is no change).
metadata.label: Illuminance Report Interval

metadata.description: The change in temperature resulting in temperature report.
metadata.label: Temperature Report Threshold

metadata.description: How often the temperature will be measured
metadata.label: Temperature Measuring Interval

metadata.description: Time interval between consecutive temperature reports (sent even when there is no change).
metadata.label: Temperature Report Interval

metadata.description: The value to be added to the actual measured temperature.
metadata.label: Temperature Offset

metadata.description: How the light behaves after motion has been detected.
metadata.label: LED Signalling Mode

states.2: Flashlight mode - LED glows white 10 seconds
states.10: Depends on the temperature (Blink again when motion is detected)
states.12: White (Blink again when motion is detected)
states.13: Red (Blink again when motion is detected)
states.14: Green (Blink again when motion is detected)
states.15: Blue (Blink again when motion is detected)
states.16: Yellow (Blink again when motion is detected)
states.17: Cyan (Blink again when motion is detected)
states.18: Magenta (Blink again when motion is detected)
states.19: LED colour depends on the temperature (Blink twice again when motion is detected)
states.20: White (Blink twice again when motion is detected)
states.21: Red (Blink twice again when motion is detected)
states.22: Green (Blink twice again when motion is detected)
states.23: Blue (Blink twice again when motion is detected)
states.24: Yellow (Blink twice again when motion is detected)
states.25: Cyan (Blink twice again when motion is detected)
states.26: Magenta (Blink twice again when motion is detected)

metadata.description: Brightness of the LED when it's on.
metadata.label: LED Brightness

metadata.description: When the light intensity is below this, the brightness of the light is 1%.
metadata.label: Low Brightness Illuminance Threshold

metadata.description: When the light intensity is above this, the brightness of the light is 1%.
metadata.label: High Brightness Illuminance Threshold

metadata.description: When the temperature is below this, the light is blue.
metadata.label: Low Temperature Threshold for Blue

metadata.description: When the temperature is above this, the light is red.
metadata.label: High Temperature Threshold for Red

metadata.description: Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue)
metadata.label: LED Tamper Alarm

states.0: LED does not indicate tamper alarm

values.propertyName: Number of Auxiliary or Heat Stages

metadata.label: Number of Auxiliary or Heat Stages

metadata.description: Variance allowed from setpoint to engage HVAC
metadata.label: Thermostat Hysteresis

metadata.description: What state is door/window when the magnet is close to the sensor
metadata.label: Door/window State

values.propertyName: Associations in Z-Wave Network Security Mode

metadata.label: Associations in Z-Wave Network Security Mode

states.0: None of the groups sent as secure

values.propertyName: Value of ON Command Sent to 2nd Association Group

metadata.label: Value of ON Command Sent to 2nd Association Group

values.propertyName: Value of OFF Command Sent to 2nd Association Group

metadata.label: Value of OFF Command Sent to 2nd Association Group

states.0: Do not send tamper cancellation report

states.3: High and low temperature alarms enabled

states.5632: Window/door is open in regular position
states.5633: Window/door is open in tilt position

metadata.label: Which inside handles can open the door (configuration)
Which outside handles can open the door (configuration)
Which inside handles can open the door (actual status)
Which outside handles can open the door (actual status)
Duration of timed mode in seconds
Seconds until lock mode times out

metadata.description: State of the Lock Status LED dipswitch on the rear panel of the door lock.
metadata.label: Dipswitch setting: Lock Status LED

metadata.description: State of the Autolock dipswitch on the rear panel of the door lock.
metadata.label: Dipswitch setting: Autolock

metadata.description: State of the Buzzer dipswitch on the rear panel of the door lock.
metadata.label: Dipswitch setting: Buzzer

metadata.description: State of the Secure Screen dipswitch on the rear panel of the door lock.
metadata.label: Dipswitch setting: Secure Screen
